meanings.definition: An interview conducted before the main interview.
meanings.sent1: During preinterviews, the employer gets to know the candidate better.
meanings.sent2: The preinterviews helped the company narrow down their choices.
meanings.sent3: The preinterviews felt like a warm-up before the real deal.
meanings.sent4: In the world of hiring, preinterviews are like appetizers before the main course.
meanings.sent5: The preinterviews were a crucial step in the hiring process.

meanings.definition: To conduct an interview before the main interview.
meanings.sent1: She preinterviews all potential candidates to save time later.
meanings.sent2: The HR manager preinterviews candidates to assess their qualifications.
meanings.sent3: He preinterviews candidates with a smile to ease their nerves.
meanings.sent4: Preinterviews can help filter out unsuitable candidates early on.
meanings.sent5: The team preinterviews applicants to ensure a smooth hiring process.
